title: IntPtr text manipulation overloads and encoding support
body: Your current implementation ignores SkPaint's encoding, I've fixed that. I've also added IntPtr-based overloads, so optimizations like passing a pointer to the part of pinned `string` can be used.

comments.author: migueldeicaza
comments.body:
I looked at this, and I think that the approach that is being taken is wasteful.

C# is passing a UTF-16 string, and we end up always creating a managed array to convert to the currently configured text encoding.   Instead, I propose that we introduce a helper method that saves the current text encoding, sets it to UTF-16, renders the passed text, and restores the previous value for the current SKPaint text encoding.
